channel.title: CVE Feed for Spring by VMware -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Spring by VMware -- all products

item.title: CVE-2020-5427|2024-09-16T19:01:12.488Z -- spring%20by%20vmware -- spring%20cloud%20data%20flow
item.description: In Spring Cloud Data Flow, versions 2.6.x prior to 2.6.5, versions 2.5.x prior 2.5.4, an application is vulnerable to SQL injection when requesting task execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-5413|2024-09-16T16:22:53.854Z -- spring%20by%20vmware -- spring%20integration
item.description: Spring Integration framework provides Kryo Codec implementations as an alternative for Java (de)serialization. When Kryo is configured with default options, all unregistered classes are resolved on demand. This leads to the "deserialization gadgets" exploit when provided data contains malicious code for execution during deserialization. In order to protect against this type of attack, Kryo can be configured to require a set of trusted classes for (de)serialization. Spring Integration should be proactive against blocking unknown "deserialization gadgets" when configuring Kryo in code.

item.title: CVE-2020-5412|2024-09-16T18:24:52.747Z -- spring%20by%20vmware -- spring%20cloud%20netflix
item.description: Spring Cloud Netflix, versions 2.2.x prior to 2.2.4, versions 2.1.x prior to 2.1.6, and older unsupported versions allow applications to use the Hystrix Dashboard proxy.stream endpoint to make requests to any server reachable by the server hosting the dashboard. A malicious user, or attacker, can send a request to other servers that should not be exposed publicly.
